key_risks: Affordability and rent increases impacting low- and middle-income residents
Regulatory and legal risks due to changes in housing regulations and legal disputes
Community opposition to manufactured home communities
Economic sensitivity tied to interest rates, employment levels, and consumer confidence
controversies: Lawsuit against the Village of Coxsackie for obstructing affordable housing development
Complaints regarding UMH's handling of debt agreements and unresolved debt issues
environmental_issues: Investments in energy-efficient homes and community upgrades to reduce environmental impact
social_issues: Scrutiny over rent increases and affordability for low- and middle-income residents
Community resistance to manufactured home communities affecting property values and neighborhood character
governance_issues: Ethical concerns and governance issues related to debt agreement handling

sources.title: UMH Properties, Inc. v. Village of Coxsackie - relmanlaw.com
sources.snippet: On October 1, 2018, Relman Colfax filed this federal lawsuit on behalf of UMH Properties, a developer seeking to build a community of affordable manufactured homes in the Village of Coxsackie, New York. The lawsuit alleges that the Village has obstructed UMH from building the community, Mountainview Estates, in response to discriminatory community opposition.
